bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 114 (Monday, June 22, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DOGGETT:H.R. 7288.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 1 of Section 8 of Article I of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H2414]

item.latestTitle: Taxpayer Research and Coronavirus Knowledge Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.name: Drug safety, medical device, and laboratory regulation
Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.title: Taxpayer Research and Coronavirus Knowledge Act of 2020

item.title: Taxpayer Research and Coronavirus Knowledge Act of 2020
Taxpayer Research and Coronavirus Knowledge Act of 2020

To direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services and other Federal officials to compile into a searchable database information relating to Federal support for biomedical research and development related to COVID-19, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
